posts.name: Nevo
posts.cooked: I Need A Good PDM Software That Works Well With Solidworks Files. Does Anyone have one?

posts.name: Rishabh
posts.cooked: We’re currently using Bild for our team with inventor. It has worked pretty well and has some nice features like an online file viewer  and an a task board.

posts.name: Nathan Nguyen
posts.cooked:
CacheCAD is a interface with Google Drive if you’re interested. It functions and looks pretty similar to GrabCAD if your team used that in the past

Introducing CacheCAD CAD

posts.name: Wyatt Retkowski
posts.cooked:
If you use SolidWorks you could look into their own pdm.

https://www.solidworks.com/product/solidworks-pdm

Not sure if they offer deals for FRC and be warned it’s not the easiest to set up, but it does work very well generally.

posts.name: Patrick
posts.cooked: SolidWorks PDM is great, but when we looked into setting it up for FRC it wasn’t really feasible. SolidWorks educational licenses do come with PDM, but you need SQL server and the setup is pretty complicated.

posts.name: Nevo
posts.cooked: Hello, a while back i posted about my need of a PDM that works well with solidworks. I settled with CacheCAD, which is developed by team 8096 Cache Money. It Worked great at first, but i ran into some problems, since the program crashes sometimes when i try to upload. maybe its not as complicated as i think, but since im not great at understanding whats going on behind the scenes of apps, I Need a company developed PDM that works with solidworks. if someone has ideas or knows about one ill be really happy if you share if maybe someone knows about a PDM company thats willing to give their product for FRC Teams that would be awesome as well. thank you

posts.name: Fletcher
posts.cooked: Solidworks makes their PDM solution available for free to FRC teams, and will offer limited support for getting it configured.

posts.name: Nishant Amirineni
posts.cooked: My team used CacheCAD for the 2024 season. We found out that it will crash given any input if it is left open for an extended period of time, or if this its first time it is being opened on startup of the device. We found that these crashes have no actual effects on the file management and simply re-opening after the crash would resolve any issues. If it is crashing mid-upload, and not just when you open the app and select upload, check to see if it is crashing when it reaches a specific file to upload. We also found an issue where if the file path is too long(I think it was when the path was beyond 255 chars) the program would crash and not finish the upload. After talking with @Mike_Schreiber about this he determined that this was probably a windows issue. realistically if your file path is beyond 255 chars anyways you should probably clean up your folder nesting.
